intro: Genista bracteolata, commonly known as the bracteolate broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, cylindrical clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Genista bracteolata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
